About me

Note: I am on the job market this year. (CV)

I am a Ph.D. student in the Department of Computer Science at University of California, Irvine. I received my B.S. degree in Computer Engineering from Isfahan University of Technology in 2003 and my M.S. degree in Computer Engineering from University of Tehran in 2006. I am currently working under supervision of Prof. Nikil Dutt in the Dutt Research Group .
My research interests are in the area of computer architecture and embedded systems with a specific focus on error resilient and energy-efficient memory design. More specifically, I am interested in cross-stack and
technology-driven innovations in memory design to improve resiliency and energy efficiency of computer systems for emerging applications. My other interests include hardware/software co-design, many-core design, and approximate computing.

Find me on LinkedIn, ACM, Arnetminer, DBLP, Google Scholar, Microsoft Academic.
